trans-unit.source: File names and locations for Azure technical articles
trans-unit.target: File names and locations for Azure technical articles

trans-unit.source: Explains the file structure for articles and the naming conventions you should follow when you create a new article.
trans-unit.target: Explains the file structure for articles and the naming conventions you should follow when you create a new article.

trans-unit.source: File names and locations for Azure technical articles
trans-unit.target: File names and locations for Azure technical articles

trans-unit.source: In our technical content repository, we use a single folder (the **articles** folder) for all articles.
trans-unit.target: In our technical content repository, we use a single folder (the **articles** folder) for all articles.

trans-unit.source: There's no folder hierarchy - all articles live in the flat file structure.
trans-unit.target: There's no folder hierarchy - all articles live in the flat file structure.

trans-unit.source: If you create folders with articles in them, your articles can't be published.
trans-unit.target: If you create folders with articles in them, your articles can't be published.

trans-unit.source: Instead of using a file structure as an organizing principle, we use a strict file naming convention that clearly identifies topics and that contributes towards discoverability on the web.
trans-unit.target: Instead of using a file structure as an organizing principle, we use a strict file naming convention that clearly identifies topics and that contributes towards discoverability on the web.

trans-unit.source: Here's what you need to know:
trans-unit.target: Here's what you need to know:

trans-unit.source: [Rules]
trans-unit.target: [Rules]

trans-unit.source: [Pattern]
trans-unit.target: [Pattern]

trans-unit.source: [Standard examples]
trans-unit.target: [Standard examples]

trans-unit.source: [Special file naming convention for the Azure preview portal]
trans-unit.target: [Special file naming convention for the Azure preview portal]

trans-unit.source: [Marketplace content]
trans-unit.target: [Marketplace content]

trans-unit.source: [File name approval]
trans-unit.target: [File name approval]

trans-unit.source: Rules
trans-unit.target: Rules

trans-unit.source: No spaces or punctuation characters.
trans-unit.target: No spaces or punctuation characters.

trans-unit.source: Use hyphens to separate the words in the file name.
trans-unit.target: Use hyphens to separate the words in the file name.

trans-unit.source: Use all lowercase letters
trans-unit.target: Use all lowercase letters

trans-unit.source: No more than 80 characters - this is a publishing system limit
trans-unit.target: No more than 80 characters - this is a publishing system limit

trans-unit.source: Use action verbs that are specific such as develop, buy, build, troubleshoot.
trans-unit.target: Use action verbs that are specific such as develop, buy, build, troubleshoot.

trans-unit.source: No -ing words.
trans-unit.target: No -ing words.

trans-unit.source: No small words - don't include a, and, the, in, or, etc.
trans-unit.target: No small words - don't include a, and, the, in, or, etc.

trans-unit.source: All files must be in markdown and use the .md file extension.
trans-unit.target: All files must be in markdown and use the .md file extension.

trans-unit.source: Pattern
trans-unit.target: Pattern

trans-unit.source: Here's the general pattern:
trans-unit.target: Here's the general pattern:

trans-unit.source: service-platform-language-content-product-version.md
trans-unit.target: service-platform-language-content-product-version.md

trans-unit.source: Use the parts of the pattern that apply, and review the list of articles in the repository to get an idea of existing names.
trans-unit.target: Use the parts of the pattern that apply, and review the list of articles in the repository to get an idea of existing names.

trans-unit.source: Names that don't start with a dev platform or a service name are probably suspect and slipped through.
trans-unit.target: Names that don't start with a dev platform or a service name are probably suspect and slipped through.

trans-unit.source: Standard examples
trans-unit.target: Standard examples

trans-unit.source: Here are a few examples of valid names that follow the pattern.
trans-unit.target: Here are a few examples of valid names that follow the pattern.

trans-unit.target: cloud-services-dotnet-continuous-delivery.md

trans-unit.target: mobile-services-ios-get-started.md

trans-unit.source: documentdb-manage-account.md
trans-unit.target: documentdb-manage-account.md

trans-unit.source: mobile-services-dotnet-backend-get-started-settings-sync.md
trans-unit.target: mobile-services-dotnet-backend-get-started-settings-sync.md

trans-unit.target: active-directory-java-authenticate-users-access-control-eclipse.md

trans-unit.target: virtual-machines-install-windows-server-2008r2.md

trans-unit.source: Special file naming convention for the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Special file naming convention for the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: Right now, we have two portals running - the [general availability portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) and the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Right now, we have two portals running - the [general availability portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) and the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: To clearly identify content that has been written for the preview portal without hiding it in the metadata, we need to follow some slightly customized file naming guidance:
trans-unit.target: To clearly identify content that has been written for the preview portal without hiding it in the metadata, we need to follow some slightly customized file naming guidance:

trans-unit.source: If the service is available only in the Azure preview portal, it's easy.
trans-unit.target: If the service is available only in the Azure preview portal, it's easy.

trans-unit.source: Just follow the standard naming guidance.
trans-unit.target: Just follow the standard naming guidance.

trans-unit.source: If the service is available in both portals, and you are writing an article about the service in the preview portal, add **preview-portal** at the end of the file name before the .md extension.
trans-unit.target: If the service is available in both portals, and you are writing an article about the service in the preview portal, add **preview-portal** at the end of the file name before the .md extension.

trans-unit.source: This will help us separate the content for that service in the old portal from content for that service in the new portal.
trans-unit.target: This will help us separate the content for that service in the old portal from content for that service in the new portal.

trans-unit.source: (Don't mix portal content!)
trans-unit.target: (Don't mix portal content!)

trans-unit.source: If the article is about the preview portal itself and not specific to any service or platform, start the file name with **azure-preview-portal**.
trans-unit.target: If the article is about the preview portal itself and not specific to any service or platform, start the file name with **azure-preview-portal**.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples:
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples:

trans-unit.source: azure-preview-portal-supported-browsers-devices.md
trans-unit.target: azure-preview-portal-supported-browsers-devices.md

trans-unit.source: storage-premium-storage-preview-portal.md
trans-unit.target: storage-premium-storage-preview-portal.md

trans-unit.source: Marketplace content
trans-unit.target: Marketplace content

trans-unit.source: To distinguish content that focuses on partner contributions to the Azure marketplace, start the file names with "marketplace".
trans-unit.target: To distinguish content that focuses on partner contributions to the Azure marketplace, start the file names with "marketplace".

trans-unit.source: This content should not be too common, as most partner content should be created on the partners' own web sites.
trans-unit.target: This content should not be too common, as most partner content should be created on the partners' own web sites.

trans-unit.source: marketplace-mongodb-virtual-machines-install-windows-server-2008r2.md
trans-unit.target: marketplace-mongodb-virtual-machines-install-windows-server-2008r2.md

trans-unit.source: File name approval
trans-unit.target: File name approval

trans-unit.source: It's the job of our group of pull request reviewers to review file names when a new file is submitted to the repository for the first time.
trans-unit.target: It's the job of our group of pull request reviewers to review file names when a new file is submitted to the repository for the first time.

trans-unit.source: Pull request reviewers should review the file name and provide feedback via the pull request comment stream if changes are needed.
trans-unit.target: Pull request reviewers should review the file name and provide feedback via the pull request comment stream if changes are needed.

trans-unit.source: The file name needs to be corrected before the pull request is accepted.
trans-unit.target: The file name needs to be corrected before the pull request is accepted.

trans-unit.source: Contributors can easily push the update to the pending pull request.
trans-unit.target: Contributors can easily push the update to the pending pull request.
